descriptive_hints: In row 8, the clue [10] means every cell in that row is filled, so you can mark them all.
Since row 6 also has a [10] clue, you can fill every cell in that row as well.
In row 7, with the clue [10], fill all cells, solidifying three entire rows.
The middle rows (6-8) are completely filled, providing a solid base for filling other areas.
In the bottom rows (9-10), the [2, 2] clues indicate four filled cells on each row, with gaps at the beginning and end.
The first column has a clue of [3], indicating three filled cells, which aligns with the bottom part of the grid.
The third column's clue of [8] suggests that all rows except the first two have filled cells in this column.
The fifth column clue [2, 3] aligns with the filled patterns on the top and bottom of the puzzle.
The eighth column clue [2, 5] matches with the filled pattern in rows 6 through 10.
The bottom quadrants reveal a mirrored pattern between the left and right halves, with two gaps on either end.
The [6] clue in the second column shows a clear pattern starting from the middle, extending to the bottom rows.
meaning_hints: Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I help you get to places fast and comfortably. What am I?'
Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I have four wheels, but I'm not a cart. I run on roads and take you from start to finish. What am I?'
Puzzle meaning riddle: 'I have an engine but I'm not a plane. I need fuel to keep moving but I'm not a rocket. What am I?'
